tasks.task: Develop a marketing plan for agricultural products
subtasks: Research factors affecting product marketability (product quality, quantity, uniqueness, timing, location, relationships)
Understand varying needs of potential buyers (e.g., restaurants requiring high-quality, consistent produce)
Base marketing plan on personal capabilities and evolve it over time
Plan to sell multiple products across various markets for flexibility
Stay organized to manage business tasks effectively
Document plans and business processes (writing, farm management software, record-keeping)
Maintain good financial records (budgets, crop records, expenses, taxes) for strategic and regulatory purposes
Regularly review and adjust business plans and records for improvement
Consider starting small and expanding gradually, especially as a new producer
Leverage relationships and resources from agricultural organizations (Alabama Extension, USDA, etc.) for support

tasks.task: Create a system for employee task delegation
subtasks: Determine responsibilities for employees on a weekly basis
Communicate set expectations to employees regarding tasks
Organize tasks to reduce stress and ensure business continuity

tasks.task: Consider the financial aspects of farming
subtasks: Keep detailed financial records (budgets, crop records, expenses, tax documents)
Use financial management tools and resources (spreadsheets, apps, paper trails) to stay organized
Regularly review finances to identify areas for improvement (cost management, profitability)
Prepare for potential audits by maintaining clear financial records
